data.message: Facebook. Why are you allowing hate speech and the advocacy of violence. I've reported someone several times but just get a response saying it doesn't violate your rules, it does. Maybe I should just contact the media. Not sure if you need more bad press

replies.message: Hmmmm. No response at all huh??

Because of the diversity of our community, it's possible that something could be disagreeable or disturbing to you without meeting the criteria for being removed or blocked. For this reason, we offer personal controls over what you see, such as the ability to hide or quietly cut ties with people, Pages, or applications that offend you. Facebook also offers tools to help you deal with bullying and harassment. Learn more at: http://bit.ly/2hKVEN6. -Elizabeth
So you allow someone to post calling for a person's family to be beheaded?? Seriously? That's ok with you guys? ?
Its inciting violence and according to your rules its not allowed.  Explain your lacks stance...

I've already contacted my local news. They have seen the posts I'm referring to and agree they are heinous and against your rules. They said to wait for your response and if you make no effort to remove the posts then in am to get back to them immediately so they can start an investigation.  So I'm taking it youre going to do nothing. Correct?

Eric Darnell I am having the same problem, reporting an OBVIOUSLY unacceptable attack on family repeatedly and repeatedly being told it "doesn't violate community standards." In my case some SCUMBAG stole a picture of my newborn baby and used it to make a disgusting attack post and Facebook will NOT take it down! No matter how many times it's been reported.
Call your local news.  Facebook cannot afford negative press.
I will. I will do whatever it takes. This crap is unacceptable. Nobody should get away with attacking people's family. And Facebook's reporting system is totally inadequate.
Let me know if you need help reporting the attack on your family, I will be happy to help. I report stuff like that when I see it whether I know the person being attacked or not.
